info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 9:51PM CDT until September 17 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Dawson.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly along small creeks/streams and some rural county roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heaviest rainfall from earlier Tuesday evening had since subsided, but a widespread 2 to 4 inches had fallen, including a personal weather station measurement of 3.56 inches three miles west of Sumner as of 930 PM CDT. As a result, minor flooding of small creeks/streams and possibly some rural roads will likely continue for at least a few more hours. In addition, at least intermittent, light to at times moderate rain could continue through much of the night, possibly dropping up to around 1 more inch of rain over parts of the Advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Wood River, Spring Creek, Crooked Creek, Kilgore Creek, Buffalo Creek, Elm Creek and French Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Sumner and Eddyville, but especially rural areas between those towns. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT WEDNESDAY
